data.title: Game Tech Wiki
data.text:
Atari 7800

The Atari 7800 was a third-generation video game console released in June 1984 and then re-released in January 1986. Atari designed the 7800 to be backward compatible with all Atari 2600 games and controllers, partly due to the commercial failure of the Atari 5200 which lacked these features.

Technical specifications[edit]

Processor: Atari SALLY 6502 ("6502C") @ 1.79 MHz Memory: 4KB (2 6116 2Kx8 RAM ICs) Video display processor: MARIA custom graphics controller @ 7.16MHz Display palette: 256 color palette out of 256 colors (16 hues * 16 luma) Resolution: 160x240 or 320x240 (NTSC)

160x288 or 320x288 (PAL)

Sound: The 2600's TIA chip (7800 games only use the sound, 2600 games use sound and video)

Hardware[edit]

Main article: Atari 7800 Hardware.
